title: INTERSPEECH_2007_40_abs

sentences.text: Information distillation aims to extract relevant pieces of information related to a given query from massive , possibly multilingual , audio and textual document sources .
In this paper , we present our approach for using information extraction annotations to augment document retrieval for distillation .
We take advantage of the fact that some of the distillation queries can be associated with annotation elements introduced for the NIST Automatic Content Extraction -LRB- ACE -RRB- task .

We experimentally show that using the ACE events to constrain the document set returned by an information retrieval engine significantly improves the precision at various recall rates for two different query templates .

Entity-the_fact_that_some_of_the_distill.description: The fact that some of the distillation queries can be associated with annotation elements introduced for the NIST Automatic Content Extraction refers to the ability to link certain information extraction queries to specific annotations created as part of the National Institute of Standards and Technology's (NIST) Automatic Content Extraction task.

summary: Information distillation aims to extract relevant pieces of information related to a given query from massive , possibly multilingual , audio and textual document sources . In this paper , we present our approach for using information extraction annotations to augment document retrieval for distillation . We take advantage of the fact that some of the distillation queries can be associated with annotation elements introduced for the NIST Automatic Content Extraction -LRB- ACE -RRB- task . We experimentally show that using the ACE events to constrain the document set returned by an information retrieval engine significantly improves the precision at various recall rates for two different query templates .

Predicate-extract_from.label: extract from
Predicate-extract_from.description: The predicate 'extract from' indicates a relationship where the subject (e.g., Information distillation) obtains or derives relevant information from a specified source, which is represented by the object. This connection implies that the subject acquires its content, insights, or knowledge from the described sources.

Predicate-present.label: present
Predicate-present.description: The predicate 'present' indicates that the subject has a current or ongoing relationship with the object. This can imply a sense of relevance, importance, or significance between the two entities.

Predicate-use.label: use
Predicate-use.description: To employ or utilize something (typically an object or resource) with a specific purpose or intention. The predicate 'use' indicates that the subject has applied, exploited, or made use of the object for a particular goal or function.

Predicate-augment.label: augment
Predicate-augment.description: To augment something means to enhance or expand its scope, content, or functionality by adding new information, features, or capabilities. This predicate connects the subject (the thing being augmented) with the object (what is being added), indicating a relationship of supplementation and improvement.

Predicate-show_that.label: show that
Predicate-show_that.description: To demonstrate or prove something's existence, validity, or truthfulness through evidence, experimentation, or other means.

Predicate-significantly_improves.label: significantly improves
Predicate-significantly_improves.description: Indicates that a change or modification has a substantial and positive impact on the outcome or performance of something. The subject's action or effort leads to a notable enhancement in the quality, effectiveness, or efficiency of the object.

Predicate-significantly_improves_the_pre.label: significantly improves the precision at various recall rates for two different query templates
Predicate-significantly_improves_the_pre.description: This predicate indicates that a given approach or method enhances the precision of retrieval results at various recall rates for two distinct query templates, suggesting an improvement in the effectiveness and efficiency of information retrieval.

Predicate-takes_advantage_of.label: takes advantage of
Predicate-takes_advantage_of.description: The predicate 'takes advantage of' indicates a relationship where the subject exploits or utilizes some aspect, characteristic, or opportunity provided by the object to achieve its goals or accomplish something. In general, it suggests that the subject benefits from or leverages the object's existence, properties, or circumstances.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: Indicates that the subject concept is more specific than or subsumed by the object concept. The predicate 'has a broader term' establishes an is-a relationship between two concepts, where the subject is a specialization of the object.
